name: ferrite production | ferrite | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7375/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of MnZn ferrite (type (Mn,Zn)O.F2O3) as one of the specific inputs to a CRT screen. It is a rough estimation of the actual ferrite production for the use in CRT screens. It is assumed for the CRT screen a MnZn ferrite (i.e. a ferrite of the type (Mn, Zn)O∙Fe2O3. Main data about a MnZn ferrite are based on general information from literature as well as estimations based on further processes of the database. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of raw materials at the factory gate.

This dataset is a rough estimation of the composition by including raw materials, energy consumption and infrastructure efforts. Waste as well as all kind of emissions are not taken into account.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2393:Manufacture of other porcelain and ceramic products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Literature data are used to establish a global valuable dataset.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average production for MnZn soft ferrites: Rotary pipe oven (presintering at 800-1000°C for 1-2 h in presence of air for initial chemical reaction), continuous attritor (regrinding and mixing for size reduction and homogenity), bull mill (grinding and mixing for size reduction and homogenity), pressing(compression molding extruding), continuous or chamber oven (sintering at 1200-1400°C under atmospheric conditions that yield a specific FeO content), mechanical working (face grinding: air gap grinding).

exchanges.description:
Ferrites are electrically non-conductive ferrimagnetic ceramic compound materials, consisting of various mixtures of iron oxides such as Hematite (Fe2O3) or Magnetite (Fe3O4) and the oxides of other metals. Those that are used in transformer or electromagnetic cores contain nickel, zinc or manganese compounds. They are called soft ferrites. MnZn and NiZn ferrites are the most common materials within the soft ferrites.
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
